title: Stoke vs West Brom feud reignites over "loser" message Tony Pulis allegedly sent Ryan Shawcross after Saturday win
text:

Angry Mark Hughes has accused Tony Pulis of branding Stoke captain Ryan Shawcross a “loser” as he stoked their row with West Brom over Saido Berahino. 
Potters manager Hughes claims Baggies counterpart Pulis left a voicemail for Shawcross hitting back at the defender’s accusation that Albion had leaked news of their ex-striker Berahino’s drug ban following his January move to Stoke. 
The warring Welshmen are refusing to let the dispute die after failing to shake hands before or after the game between their teams at The Hawthorns last week, which West Brom won 1-0. 
Hughes said: “We were annoyed with a number of things about that. 
“I was annoyed with their manager ringing up Ryan on the Monday morning after the game and calling him a loser. I wasn't too happy with that, but hey-ho! Shawcross feels the Berahino news came from someone at Albion (Photo: Action Images via Reuters) 
"But any number of things surrounding the game were unnecessary.” 
Hughes was adamant the alleged message from Pulis was not tongue-in-cheek and claimed the West Brom boss had not answered Shawcross when the defender tried to ring back. 
Asked if the ‘loser’ remark had been made in jest, Hughes said: “What do you think? I don’t think so. 
“There was a voicemail left, and I haven’t heard it. Ryan wasn’t too pleased about it and tried to call back. But he didn’t get any answer. 
“That’s what the situation is as we sit here.” West Brom beat visitors Stoke last Saturday with a James Morrison goal (Photo: Reuters) 
Pulis confirmed missed calls from Shawcross, who he has previously hailed as one of his greatest ever signings. 
“Ryan has tried to ring me since that and I will get back to him,” said the West Brom boss. “Charlie Adam, not at all. 
"That makes no difference to me! 
"I think people know the facts. 
"It was a sideshow. The great thing was everybody talked about the game. That was the main show.” Pulis finally cashed in on Berahino in January after years of transfer speculation (Photo: PA) 
Former Stoke boss Pulis brought former Manchester United youngster Shawcross to the club in 2007 and later made him skipper. 
But the 29-year-old suggested Albion had spilled the beans over Berahino’s secret ban, and Hughes is now furious about the message he claims Pulis left for his skipper on Monday. 
Berahino was an ineffective substitute in Saturday's match, after which Hughes, Shawcross and midfielder Adam all pointed the finger at the Baggies over the leak. Like us on Facebook
